bug.author: ifeherva
bug.summary: SE layers are ignored when constructing se_resnets
bug.description: gluoncv.model_zoo.get_model('se_resnet50_v1') and gluoncv.model_zoo.get_model('resnet50_v1') returns the same model since the use_se flag is never used. The error is here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L555>https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L555</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Interestingly, the code does not work even if I force the use_se flag. In particular I get an error here: https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L190 Check failed: l == 1 || r == 1: operands could not be broadcast together with shapes [2,256,56,56] [2,1024,1,1]

I believe here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L163>https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/blob/master/gluoncv/model_zoo/resnet.py#L163</denchmark-link>
the correct statement is self.se.add(nn.Dense(channels, use_bias=False)) instead of self.se.add(nn.Dense(channels * 4, use_bias=False))
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ifeherva>@ifeherva</denchmark-link> Thank you for pointing this out. We will fix it soon.
Already fixed the issue in PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-cv/pull/1115>#1115</denchmark-link> , close the issue for now.
